dataIdInfo.idAbs: Updated vegetation delineation for the island of Guam based on 2016 WorldView 2 imagery and the 2014 Forest Service/NOAA vegetation map of the island. Includes general and detailed vegetation categories based on this assessment and cross-walked landcover categories for NOAA’s CCAP classification and the Forest Service’s assessment of Guam. This file is one of a series of files associated with a vegetation delineation of the Mariana Islands.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Vegetation delineation for the island of Guam.

idPoC.rpOrgName: Pacific Islands Fish and Wildlife Office, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service

report.measDesc: Visual inspection of vegetation characterization based on available imagery.
Visual inspection of vegetation classification using pan-sharpened imagery.

dataSource.srcDesc: Worldview 2 satellite imagery obtained from DigitalGlobe.

prcStep.stepDesc: The updated delineation was developed using 2012, 2016 and 2017 satellite imagery, 2012 Lidar Data from USGS, and the 2014 vegetation map of Guam by the Forest Service/NOAA. Object-oriented classification methods, using eCognition Developer 9 (Trimble), were used to identify areas that were cleared or developed since the 2012 imagery and the 2014 vegetation map, which was based on the 2012 imagery, and to delineate the following new classes: Vitex Forest, Bamboo Thicket, Hibiscus Thicket, Grassland, and Coastal Scrub. The 2014 map was used for initial segmentation and delineation of vegetation/land cover classes. Multi-resolution segmentation of each vegetation/land cover class was then conducted and rule-sets based on spectral thresholds, object geometry, and relationships between objects were used to identify changes in classification. Vegetation/land cover class and the presence/absence of changes in class were assessed for accuracy visually using pan-sharpened images of the island at random points. The final classification was edited manually to ensure consistent classifications and to remove any observed errors. See the report associated with this project for further details.

stepProc.rpOrgName: Pacific Islands Fish and Wildlife Office, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service

attr.attrdef: Detailed description of dominate vegetation or landcover at location. Potential values include: Bare Rock, Bare Soil/Gravel, Sand, Developed, Developed Vegetation, Mixed Grass/Herbaceous, Grassland, Coastal Scrub, Scrub/Shrub, Bamboo Thicket, Casuarina Forest, Coconut Forest, Hibiscus Thicket, Leucaena Thicket, Vitex Forest, Mixed Introduced Forest, Native Limestone Forest, Native Volcanic Forest, Emergent Wetland, Mangrove, Cloud, Shadow, and Open Water. See the report associated with this dataset for additional details.
NOAA CCAP classification of the location. See https://coast.noaa.gov/digitalcoast/training/ccap-land-cover-classifications.html for details.

Forest Service landcover category for the location. Forest Service landcover categories are base on the Liu 2014 classification of Guam. Additional details and a list of categories can be found in the report at http://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/r5/forest-grasslandhealth/?cid=fsbdev3_046690.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
